intro: Eriocaulon botocudo, commonly known as the Botocudo sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Brazil and is typically found in wetland and marshy habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
